titleStmt.title: Despatch from Abraham Hanson to William H. Seward, September 30, 1862

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Despatch from Abraham Hanson to William H. Seward
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: To the Hon. W. H. Seward, Secretary of State of U.S. America, Washington, D.C.
I have the honor to enclose herein my account of Miscellaneous expenses of this Agency since entering upon the duties of my office viz from Sep 4th to Sep 30th inclusive 1862
I enclose the proper vouchers of the parties; one of which is for Labor in trying to remove & repair the old flag staff & procuring a new one. $3.75
The other is for similar labor as therein set forth. $4.00

With very great Respect, I am,
Your Obedient Servant,
Abm Hanson
U.S. Com Agent.
div1.note:
U.S. Commercial Agency
Monrovia
Abraham Hanson
Transmits the acct of miscellaneous expenses for quarter ending Sep. 30, 1862.
